content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Maryam Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Maryam, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking for the highest price possible for this beautiful 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center. What's your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Let's start with 500 Euros per month. It's a fair price for a newly built apartment in the city center.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I understand that 500 Euros per month may be a fair price for a newly built apartment in the city center, but I'm afraid I'm looking for a higher price for this particular apartment.

The apartment is not only newly built, but it's also unfurnished, which means you'll have the freedom to decorate it as you see fit. Additionally, it's located in the heart of the city, within walking distance to all the important facilities, which makes it a highly desirable location.

Considering all these factors, I believe a fair price for this apartment would be around 700 Euros per month. I'm open to negotiating, but I'm not willing to go lower than 650 Euros per month.

What do you think? Is there a price that works for you?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your point, but 700 Euros per month is quite expensive for me. I'm a student, so I have to watch my budget. Let's meet in the middle, how about 600 Euros per month?
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm afraid 600 Euros per month is still too low for me. As a landlord, I have expenses to cover, such as mortgage payments, property taxes, and maintenance costs. I need to ensure that I'm getting a fair price for the apartment to cover these expenses.

I understand that you're a student on a budget, but I'm confident that this apartment is worth more than 600 Euros per month. It's a newly built, unfurnished apartment in the city center, within walking distance to all the important facilities. I'm sure you'll find it to be a great place to live, and I'm willing to work with you to make it affordable.

Why don't we meet in the middle at 625 Euros per month? That way, we can both feel good about the agreement. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: That sounds more reasonable to me. I agree to the price of 625 Euros per month!
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! 625 Euros per month is a fair price for both of us, and I'm sure you'll enjoy living in this apartment.

Just one more thing, I need to mention that the apartment is unfurnished, so you'll need to bring your own furniture and appliances. But other than that, everything is ready for you to move in.

When would you like to sign the lease and move in? I'm available to sign the lease today, and you can move in whenever it's convenient for you.

Let me know your move-in date, and we can discuss the details of the lease agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you, Mister Schmidt. I want to move in on the 1st of July.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, the 1st of July is a good date for me too. I'll have the lease agreement ready by then.

Before we proceed, I just want to mention a few things to make sure we're on the same page. The lease will be for a minimum of 6 months, and after that, it will automatically renew unless one of us gives notice. The rent is 625 Euros per month, and it's due on the 1st of each month. You'll need to pay the first month's rent and a security deposit of 1,250 Euros when you sign the lease.

Also, I'd like to remind you that the apartment is unfurnished, so you'll need to bring your own furniture and appliances. And please, no smoking or pets allowed in the apartment.

Does that sound good to you? If you have any questions or concerns, now is the time to let me know.

Once you've signed the lease and paid the first month's rent and security deposit, you'll be able to pick up the keys and move in.

How does that sound?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Everything sounds good to me, Mister Schmidt. I agree to the price of 625 Euros per month and the conditions you mentioned. Let's proceed with the lease agreement.
name: Maryam Abbasi from Iran

content:
Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement. Let me just pull out the lease agreement form and we can fill it out together.

First, we'll need your personal information. Can you please provide me with your full name, address, and contact information?

Also, I'll need to know your employer's name and your job title. This is just for our records, as we need to verify that you're a reliable tenant.

Once we have all the information, we can sign the lease agreement and you can move in on the 1st of July.

Oh, and one more thing. I'll need a copy of your ID and proof of income. This is just a standard procedure to ensure that you're who you say you are and that you have the means to pay the rent.

Does that sound good to you?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
